page.title: 02Brightwalton Village School
page.content: The{School}was{built}at the same time as the church to{a design by G.E. {Street c.1863}on a site of about 2.5 acres.The buildings have{2 large class {rooms}one doubles for lunches and a {library/computer/T.V}area.The office & staff toilet & children's cloakrooms flank the 2 entrances.{The kitchen}is small and{reheats frozen meals}sent weekly from a school in Newbury.The {grounds are a feature being flat and {spacious}with a{hard playground}and {large area of grass planted with many {trees.}The school has{28 children a {Head Master and one assistant teacher. Other staffing is a{Secretary}for two afternoons and a morning each week, a {Cleaner in charge,a Kitchen Supervisor {and Playground Controller.}Pupils come from a wide area including{Farnborough {Fawley,Catmore and Lilley}and some from{Leckhampstead.
